Welcome to Jekyll!

Feb 27, 2015

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

class Foo < Bar
  def print_hi(name)
    puts "Hi, #{name}"
    hash   = {foo: "bar"}
    hash2  = {:foo => "bar"}
    number = 1234 + 4321
    float  = 1.2
    regex  = /foobar/
  end
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.

javascript

 1 var foo = "bar";
 2 window.foo = foo;
 3 thing = {
 4   ize: function() {
 5     return "thingy";
 6   },
 7   _private: 1234
 8 }
 9 obj = new Object;
10 array = [1,2,3,4];
11 object = {foo: "bar"}

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.
